title: Ticket #211: Chmod of transferred executables often fails
description: A user ran into a problem where their jobs are sometimes failing with a permission error on condor_exec.exe. Looking at a sampling of StarterLog files, on some machines (e.g., manta.cs.wisc.edu and zeus04.stat.wisc.edu) it seems like every time a vanilla job, at least, is started, that's preceeded by the message "warning: unable to chmod condor_exec.exe to ensure execute bit is set: Operation not permitted". On other machines (e.g., clover-25.cs.wisc.edu) the chmod doesn't always fail.
remarks:
2009-Sep-23 16:54:05 by tannenba:
Lowering the priority and severity of this ticket, as the user didn't have the execute bit set on the executable....

2009-Oct-05 18:55:15 by danb:
I have committed a fix for this problem. The bug appears to be from checkin [bee40ba6]. The problem is that when Condor is running as root, the files are downloaded in PRIV_USER, but the chmod was running as PRIV_CONDOR.
